intro: Ardisia cuprea, commonly known as the red evergreen or red bower, is a flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Ardisia cuprea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
